description.narrative: The project is intended to support the modernization of VET institutions in Azerbaijan to deliver competence-based training in order to increase the attractiveness and labour market relevance of VET.

activity-description.narrative: Project activities will be piloted in seven VET schools/centers (four in Baku and three in the regions - Ganja, Jalilabad and Sheki).

description.narrative: seat of a first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Project activities will be piloted in seven VET schools/centers (four in Baku and three in the regions - Ganja, Jalilabad and Sheki).
Project activities will be piloted in seven VET schools/centers (four in Baku and three in the regions - Ganja, Jalilabad and Sheki).

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of beneficiaries at risk and those delivering mine action in the vicinity of the former LOC are better informed of the defined nature and extent of mine and UXO contamination as a result of established information management system with appropriate and accessible data 1.2 Number of persons trained on survey, methods, standards and information management. 1.3 Adoption of new risk technology innovations for use by stakeholders in Azerbaijan 2.1 No of applications to targeted VET providers (sex disaggregated) 2.2 Perception of VET among youth as an attractive path to gaining employment - percentage of VET students of target VET Centres around 20% 3.1 No of VET activities involving the participation of private sector entities (businesses) e.g. PPPs 3.2 No of company and employee of private companies engaged VET process (organization of internship etc.) 3.3 Businesses’ perception of VET as a credible partner for developing workers’ skills (qualitative indicator) 4.1 No of developed documents and recommendations related VET with participation of all VET stakeholders 4.2 No of coordination and social dialog meetings with all VET participant and stakeholders 4.3 No of Quality Apprenticeship program implemented in selected VET Providers (social dialogue, regulation framework etc. Businesses’ perception of VET as a credible partner for developing workers’ skills (qualitative indicator)

comment.narrative: 1) 10 new programs (2021-2024) 2) 10 initiative with the involvement of private sector (internship, examination, WBL, Advisory board, career support, curriculum development) (2020-2023) 3) No of company and employee of private companies engaged VET process (organization of internship etc.) Additional 55 companies / 90 employees of companies (2021-2024) 4) 4 (NSC, Advisory board, Apprenticeship Alliance, Guidance on Career Support) 5) No of coordination and social dialog meetings with all VET participant and stakeholders (15 roundtables) 6) 3 WBL (2021-2022), 2 WBL (2023-2024) 7) No of VET facilities renovated and supplied (disaggregated by type) e.g. 8) No of facilities receiving COVID-19 specific supplies, equipment and associated infrastructure 9) Training and team building activities for career guidance (5 trainings and 3 teambuilding (2021-2024)) 10) No of advisory boards and school strategic development plans developed 11) Needs of PwD and vulnerable groups 12) 1 Guidelines and tools for work with PwD are developed 13) Needs assessment about career guidance service 14) Research about low interest towards VET 15) New career guidance developed 16) Activities boost attractiveness of VET schools and career service 17) Development of digital learning resources 18) Guidelines for income generation activities and competitive financing mechanism (small grants) are prepared 19) 3 Feasibility and 5 business plans for private sector cooperation and establishment of learning factory 20) Webinars for training of teacher and managers 21) No of developed training program No of delivered trainings 22) No of National Skills Council (NSC) on VET of Azerbaijan established and operational 23) Round table with employers (15 roundtables (2021-2024) 24) A communication strategies (developed by the intervention) adopted by SAVE 25) 50 staff (5 training and 2 teambuilding events) / (2021-2024) trained in communications skills (VET Providers, SAVE staff) 26) 30% of activities to be implemented underdeveloped communication strategy for SAVE 27) No of support activity for organization of local skills competition in VET

1) 4 new Dual programmes 2) 4 WBL-Dual Programme 3) Additional 6 company 4) 3 (NSC, Advisory Board, Guidance on Career support services) (2021) 5) 8 round tables (2021) 6) 4 WBL (2021-2022). 7) During reporting period design for renovation or re-construction and assess equipment needs and technical specifications were prepared September 2021 8) SAVE requested to purchase 1,5 mln pieces of medicine disposal face masks using contingency fund of EU allocated within the project in September 2020. Bidding process was posted in the e-tendering system of UNDP and tender process was in the finalization stage. But, due to the lockdown in the country in the end of 2020 and closing of all education centers/schools as well as VET centers this bidding process became out of priority of the SAVE and the bidding process was cancelled. The process postponed until the further notice. According to the internal discussions during the planning of activities with SAVE, it was decided to go with the bidding process in October,2021. 9) 3 trainings (2020-2021) 10) 1 Advisory Board -Board of Trustees (2020-2021) a. 6 SDPs (2021) 11) 2 desk review PIETA + Int consultant 12) 1 toolkit for PwD training (2020-2021) 13) Assessment report (2020-2021) 14) Assessment report (2020-2021) 15) Career guidance and handbook 16) in Ganja+ 2 in Shaki secondary school visit, 3 offline open door days (Ganja,Jalilabad)-3 online open days (Ganja,Shaki, Baku) 17) 1 online course, 51 video lessons (2021) 18) Guidelines for income generation activities 19) 1 Business Plan on Landscape design and nursery 20) iv. 1 webinar 21) 2 trainings 2020-2021) a. 2 trainings (2020-2021) 22) 1 NSC (all documents developed and submitted. Initially agreed that 1st meeting will be held in December 2021. Afterwards, it was postponed by end of February,2022 by SAVE. 23) 8 roundtables (2021) 24) Comms strategy (2021) 25) 30 staff (1 training and 1 teambuilding event (2020-2021) 26) At least 5% in 2020-2021 27) World Skills provided guideline and standards to SAVE, Azerbaijan, therefore cancelled.
